column4: I have asked this alot and nobody has answered does gnome 2.10 has composite features such and translucency built in or I need xcompmgr?
is the X supporintg translucency without bugs int Hoary?
well X is supporting translucency without bugs for some time now
since release 6.8.0 of X.org
when i installed the X 6.8.0, and I enabled the translucency, it crashed after some time
but my video card is not very good, then because that i don't know if it was my video os bug
*or
it depends on video card
uau, it should be nice......how much fps do you get?
about 2,200 fps in glxgears I have an old geforce 3 ti200
uau, heheheh.........I get only 400 fps :( . My video card is a ATI Mobile. It don't have a AGP card
Thats it ati doesn't support Linux well and neither translucencys
yeah, i know. But we don't have much choice when you are buying a laptop
it's true
a little help plz, do you know how to change the variable PATH in debian?
